page.title: 08PARISH HALL, UFFCULME
page.content: { Uffculme Parish Hall}was built on land (Magelake Meadow) which was donated to the village by Thomas Brice in 1943 .The hall was built by voluntary labour from the Village with County grants and through much local fundraising. The building was completed in 1977. It is now used as a hall for Village activities such as dances, discos and wedddings and it is also used regularly by the Mums and Toddlers Group. It has a kitchen, committee/bar room, changing rooms and a large car park. The attached sports ground means that it doubles as changing rooms and tea room for cricket and football teams. Weekly Bingo sessions supplement income. There is much potential for future expansion in conjunction with Village sports teams as a club house/amienity.
